Job Description:
+ Role of Interior and Spatial Designer is involved in the design and renovation of internal spaces, including structural alterations, furnishings, fixtures and fittings, lighting and color. Interior and spatial designers work in commercial or domestic settings. The job combines the efficient and functional use of space with an understanding of aesthetics.

+ Designs and feasibility studies are produced for commercial, leisure and domestic properties, and the designer oversees the project from beginning to end.
Based Work

o	Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models.
o	Develop ideas and acquire key information about potential projects, discussing requirements in detail with clients (the brief) and setting project schedules Understanding clients' needs and needs of people using the building, developing design concepts in consultation with the client and establishing final briefs Consider materials and costs according to set budgets
o	Conduct feasibility studies for projects
o	Research and gather information and photographs relating to the project
o	Produce 'sample' boards for presentation to clients
o	Source products, e.g. fittings, furniture, lighting, finishes, decoration and dressing, and providing samples for clients
o	Preparing detailed working drawings, designs, plans, models and schemes, using computer-aided design (CAD) software
o	Providing documentation, detailed instructions, drawings, or specifications to tell others about how devices, parts, equipment, or structures are to be fabricated, constructed, assembled, modified, maintained, or used
o	Survey building and sites with Site Manager
o	Work in a team with other designers
o	Supervise work at the design stage and on assist Site Manager on site
o	Working closely with Project Manager to establish costs and work schedules on larger projects, with architects and other design professionals to determine the best use of space, and with manufacturers and contractors
o	Identify new business and sell services to potential clients
o	Keep up to date with new developments in the design industry
Job Requirement:
+ Understanding of Company Design Process:
o	In the development of projects for clients, follow the Company 'Design Process' as outlined in the Admin file on the Company Interiors Server
o	When developing a new design concept for a client - ensure good process by following the 'General Project Process' documents
o	Once a project is in production, always ensure that you take responsibility for the details of any project that is your design. Never expect that contractors will manage themselves. Follow Project Management Process documents
+ Communication:
o	Inform yourself and communicate with a wide range of suppliers including the capacity of current suppliers, and potentially new suppliers in order to be able to put together suggestions for new clients quickly and easily.
o	Meet clients in the office and visit potential projects sites with BD or PM
o	Maintain email communications with clients until the point of dealing.with invoices and quotation o	then hand over in a clear manner to the relevant admin staff
o	In the case of problematic communications with clients inform Design Manager or
o	Senior Project Manager, GM or MD for assistance ASAP. Always be professional and timely when representing Compnay
o	Participate in daily meetings with Project Manager, Business Development team,
o	General Manager and design team to ensure regular and clear communication regarding existing and potential projects/clients and ensure that production expectations are being met.
o	Provide all design information to the production team, so they can produce correctly.
+ Office Based Work
o	Update appointments DAILY into office calendar and throughout the week Follow and maintain existing server structure for document management Answer the office phone the Showroom or Admin staff are unable to answer
